 
Problem description.
 There are a large number of books that a bookworm has to read. He decided to read a book and mark it as read. Now whenever he finishes reading he marks it as read and looks for another book randomly. If the book he picks is already read then he skips that otherwise reads it.
Help him find out whether the book is read or not. Print yes if read otherwise no. 

Input
Input description.

 The first line of the input contains an integer Q denoting the number of queries. The description of Q test cases is as follows.
The first line of each query contains an integer (1 for marking and 2 for checking) C that denotes the choice and another integer ID denotes the index of the book to be marked or checked if read or not.

 

Output
Output description.

For each test case, output "yes" or "no" whenever choice is 2

 

Constraints : 

1 ≤ Q ≤ 1000000
1 ≤ ID ≤ 1000000000

 

Example
Input:
8
1 4
1 450
1 23
2 450
2 500
1 12
1 40
2 12

Output:
yes
no
yes

 Note : Use printf/scanf instead of cin/cout
